Articles.Content:
I've come back to KSP recently after a long break, on a new computer, and im hoping to do what i've been planning for a while. Im planning to do my own sort of colonisation of Duna, i'll give a sort of scenario overview:

The goal is to create large colonies on Duna, and I mean quite large scale. Here are the mods ive downloaded so far, to show you what I mean:

-Standard KE and KAC for things.

-USI Life support, and the colonisation pack too

-Konstruction, for the fun of assembly on site

-Coyote Space Industries, yes, thats the scale im planning

And also other little things that I think go along with this, Inventory system etc.

Can anyone suggest any mods that might synergies with these? Are they compatible? Also is there a mod that allows 'using' tourists as you please? Its just that I don't want to just have Pilots, Engineers etc. on my colony, some civilians would be cool. Thanks :)

What is the state of the Civilian Population mod these days?  Look into that though it might not be up to date. 

EPL or Ground Construction would be good for building modules on site for Konstruction to move into place.

15 minutes ago, overkill13 said:

What is the state of the Civilian Population mod these days?  Look into that though it might not be up to date. 

EPL or Ground Construction would be good for building modules on site for Konstruction to move into place.

Civilian Pop is fully up to date:

46 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Civilian Pop is fully up to date:

 

Yes, ive had a look at that before, don't really like how Civilians are sort of like a resource.
Modding question moved to the modding subforum.
